alert.note: Alert for Darlington; Florence (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wilmington (Northeastern South Carolina and Southeastern North Carolina - Wilmington)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 16 at 8:05PM EST until further notice by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Wilmington NC has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in South Carolina... Black Creek At Quinby affecting Darlington and Florence Counties. For the Black Creek...including Quinby, Black Creek Nr Hartsville... Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY MORNING UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Black Creek at Quinby. * WHEN...From Monday morning until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 13.5 feet, Floodwaters begin to affect one mobile home on Creekside Drive and continue to rise in yards. At 14.0 feet, Floodwaters surround the majority of homes on East Black Creek Road, Creekside Drive and Crooked Creek Drive and all residents are isolated due to the floodwaters. Water is lapping at the foundations of all ground level homes in these areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:00 PM EST Saturday the stage was 3.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage Monday morning and continue rising to a crest of 13.9 feet early Tuesday afternoon. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=ilm . The next statement will be issued by Sunday afternoon.
